abstract: Each Major League Baseball team has their own set of hand signals that they use before every pitch; teams use these nonverbal signs, which date back to Civil War, for plays like hit-and-runs, bunts, steals and more.
lead_paragraph: Nonverbal signs from coaches and catchers allow rapid adjustment by batters and pitchers, but players don’t always pick them up under the pressure of an at-bat.

headline.main: In a High-Tech Era, Baseball Teams Still Talk With Their Hands
headline.print_headline: In a High-Tech Era, Ball Clubs Still Talk With Their Hands
